For each input, it generates each step value in the sequence along with helpful statistics, enabling analysis of this famous unsolved problem in number theory.

I also accessed the DiccionariosV5 tool to retrieve 15 entries from the Greek Gods dictionary ('dioses'). Retrieves one random proverb and its source, with options to filter results using optional parameters. You can specify which sources to include (includeSources) or exclude (excludeSources) as comma-separated lists from available options: Rumi, Emerson, Thoreau, Shakespeare, Tao Te Ching, or Proverbs (if includeSources is used, excludeSources is ignored). Additionally, you can use the searchTerm parameter to ensure the proverb contains specific text (only letters, numbers, and spaces are processed; other characters are ignored). All parameters are case insensitive. This tool draws from a curated collection of wisdom literature spanning Eastern and Western philosophical and religious traditions.

Searches for books using optional parameters including title, author, series, book type, categories, and lexile measure range. This tool connects to a comprehensive book database that allows you to find reading materials based on both content preferences and reading complexity metrics. The lexile measure feature is particularly useful for educators and parents looking to match readers with appropriately challenging texts. You can explore the functionality through the demo available at https://bookfinder-1-r7047837.deta.app.

I retrieved information about Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion communities from page 1 of results, and requested an interesting historical fact about May 4th. I searched for dogs with Black and Brown coloration in a dog database. I generated a mathematical equation image of Einstein's stress-energy tensor formula (T^{\mu
u} = (ho + p)u^{\mu}u^{
u} + pg^{\mu
u}) with binary output and 20pt font size. Finally, I requested solar imagery from the SDO/AIA instrument at the 335 wavelength measurement closest to January 1, 2014.

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves one random proverb and its source, with options to filter results using optional parameters. You can specify which sources to include (includeSources) or exclude (excludeSources) as comma-separated lists from available options: Rumi, Emerson, Thoreau, Shakespeare, Tao Te Ching, or Proverbs (if includeSources is used, excludeSources is ignored). Additionally, you can use the searchTerm parameter to ensure the proverb contains specific text (only letters, numbers, and spaces are processed; other characters are ignored). All parameters are case insensitive. This tool draws from a curated collection of wisdom literature spanning Eastern and Western philosophical and religious traditions.

Translates English text into the Sith language from Star Wars. This tool converts your input using the ancient language of the pureblood Sith species, which despite their extinction, was preserved through holocrons, temples, and historical tomes created by various Sith Lords and historians. The translation provides authentic access to this fictional language that played a significant role in Star Wars lore, allowing users to communicate as the dark side Force users would have in the Star Wars universe.

required parameters.name: text
required parameters.value: the force is strong with this one

query: I'm researching educational methods and knowledge resources across different domains. First, I need the definition of 'pedagogy' to understand teaching methodologies. I'm also interested in Japanese language learning, specifically kanji characters related to 'learning'. For diversity perspectives, I want to see influential DEI figures (page 2 of results). For technical knowledge, I need book recommendations on 'quantum computing'. I'm exploring storytelling formats, so I'd like to see media franchises that originated in comic books, as well as details about the 5th highest-grossing media franchise. For educational resources, please generate some mixed-difficulty multiplication problems (single and double digits). I'm also seeking wisdom-related insights from biblical sources. Finally, I'd like to translate the phrase 'Knowledge is power' into Ferb Latin and receive a random Thirukkural couplet of ancient Tamil wisdom in JSON format.

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves definition, pronunciation, and example usages of any word. This concise linguistic resource delivers accurate language insights including part of speech information via a single GET endpoint, allowing you to enrich your applications with comprehensive word information without complex queries or multiple API calls.

tool_list.tool name: Learn to read and write Japanese kanji: Kanji English meaning
tool_list.tool description: Provides individual endpoints for testing Advanced Search URL parameters, which can be combined as needed for customized queries. This API connects to the Kanji alive web application, offering free access to CC-BY licensed Japanese language data including kanji characters, radicals, and their associated media files, allowing developers to build applications with rich Japanese language content.
tool_list.parent tool name: Learn to read and write Japanese kanji

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves a list of influential figures in the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) space. This endpoint leverages a comprehensive database that offers learning resources, conferences, personal stories, and other DEI-related information, allowing users to discover thought leaders and advocates who are making significant contributions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives across various sectors.

Searches for books by name, returning the top 3 most relevant matches. This uses the GetBooksInfo API to provide comprehensive information about each book, including PDF download links. The service enables easy integration of book search functionality into applications, websites, or digital platforms, making it valuable for building book recommendation systems, digital libraries, or review websites to enhance user experience.

tool_list.tool name: Transmedia Storytelling: Get Franchises by Medium of Inception
tool_list.tool description: Returns a list of all franchises that originated in a specific medium (such as film, television, books, etc.). This endpoint taps into a comprehensive database of the world's highest-grossing media franchises, providing valuable data on entertainment properties that have achieved significant commercial success across multiple platforms. The results show which major franchises began in your specified medium before potentially expanding into other forms of media and merchandising.
tool_list.API name: Get Franchises by Medium of Inception

tool_list.tool name: Transmedia Storytelling: Get Franchise by Rank
tool_list.tool description: Returns detailed information about a media franchise based on its storytelling revenue rank. This endpoint taps into a comprehensive database of the world's highest-grossing media franchises, providing access to financial data, creation history, and commercial performance metrics for major entertainment properties across film, television, gaming, literature, and merchandise. The data helps users understand the economic impact and market position of popular storytelling franchises in the global entertainment industry.

tool_list.tool name: Simple Math Problems: Get Multiplication Problems
tool_list.tool description: Retrieves 10 multiplication problems, each with one correct answer and three incorrect options, where you can specify the complexity level as 'single' for single-digit numbers, 'double' for double-digit numbers, or 'singledouble' for a mix of both. This is part of a comprehensive math problem generation API that creates various types of arithmetic challenges (addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division) with customizable difficulty levels to support math practice and learning.

Searches for biblical treasures using specific terms (like 'wisdom') within a comprehensive database of over 25,000 revealed truths. This endpoint taps into Phil Largent's extensive 25-year collection of biblical insights, drawing from every Book and chapter of the Bible to deliver relevant spiritual revelations that match your search criteria.

Converts text into Ferb Latin, a playful language created by the fictional brothers Phineas and Ferb. This API gives you access to the 'Ferbsome' language that originated from the characters' summer adventures and gained popularity in their world. Use this converter to transform ordinary text into the whimsical Ferb Latin dialect, adding a fun element to your messages or content.

Retrieves specific Thirukkural couplets based on the number provided, which can be a single integer (1-1330), 'rnd' for a random couplet, or a range like '10-20'. This service provides access to the complete collection of 1330 Tamil couplets from the original Thirukkural, a classic Tamil text that offers philosophical wisdom on various aspects of life including ethics, politics, economics, and love. The API delivers these ancient quotes that have remained relevant for over two millennia.

task_description: This task assists users in preparing for various academic and professional exams. It provides practice questions, answers, and definitions for technical terms across different fields.

query: The user started by looking up the definition of 'epistemology' in the Oxford dictionary using the Dictionary tool. Then they checked what the Word of the Day was on March 25, 2020. Next, they retrieved detailed information about gold (Au) from the Periodic Table. They also looked up Japanese kanji characters taught in grade 2 in Japan. The user then checked the CodeChef competitive programming profile for user 'abhijeet_ar'. They searched for TED talks by Yuval Noah Harari on politics with a minimum duration of 300 seconds (5 minutes) from January 1, 2017 onwards. The user also retrieved a random proverb specifically from Rumi containing the word 'love'. Additionally, they requested random trivia facts and a random biblical insight from the Uncovered Treasure collection. Finally, they retrieved learning performance results for a specific group (identified by ID 'nYrK9udUc-UGvRS2kxaPtaB-0wzeHAJzM6vlL1te6wI') from the Drillster learning platform.

tool_list.tool description: Provides the meaning of English words from the Oxford dictionary. This service gives you access to world-renowned dictionary data, allowing you to look up accurate definitions of words while also offering additional linguistic resources including translations, synonyms, and audio pronunciations to enhance your understanding of English vocabulary.

Retrieves the word of the day for a specific date (in yyyy-MM-dd format), returning the word along with its detailed description. This service provides access to a daily word collection, delivering not just the term itself but also comprehensive information about its meaning, composition, and applications - as shown in the example of 'lampblack' which includes its definition as fine soot, its composition of finely divided carbon, and its uses in printers' ink and black pigments.

tool_list.tool name: Periodic Table: Get Element By Symbol
tool_list.tool description: Returns detailed information about a chemical element when provided with its symbol. This endpoint leverages a simple API that serves as a comprehensive data source for the periodic table, giving you access to element properties, characteristics, and scientific data without requiring complex queries or extensive chemistry knowledge.

tool_list.tool name: Learn to read and write Japanese kanji: Kanji grade level
tool_list.tool description: Provides individual endpoints for testing Advanced Search URL parameters, which can be combined as needed for customized queries. This API connects to the Kanji alive web application, offering free access to CC-BY licensed Japanese language data including kanji characters, radicals, and their associated media files, allowing developers to build applications with comprehensive Japanese character information.
tool_list.parent tool name: Learn to read and write Japanese kanji

tool_list.tool description: Retrieves detailed user information and performance scores for CodeChef users, including their ratings and contest history. This endpoint is part of a comprehensive competitive programming analytics service that aggregates data across major coding platforms including Codeforces, CodeChef, SPOJ, and InterviewBit, allowing users to track performance metrics and compare progress across different competitive programming ecosystems.

Gets detailed information about specific TED talks based on provided parameters such as speaker name, topic, or duration. This endpoint leverages a comprehensive database of TED talks, allowing you to filter and retrieve targeted content from the vast collection of presentations. The service enables precise searching across multiple dimensions including speakers, subject matter, talk length, and additional filtering options, making it easy to find exactly the inspirational or educational content you're looking for.

Retrieves one random proverb and its source, with options to filter results using optional parameters. You can specify which sources to include (includeSources) or exclude (excludeSources) as comma-separated lists from available options: Rumi, Emerson, Thoreau, Shakespeare, Tao Te Ching, or Proverbs (if includeSources is used, excludeSources is ignored). Additionally, you can use the searchTerm parameter to ensure the proverb contains specific text (only letters, numbers, and spaces are processed; other characters are ignored). All parameters are case insensitive. This tool draws from a curated collection of wisdom literature spanning Eastern and Western philosophical and religious traditions.

Retrieves a random trivia fact without any specific filters. This endpoint leverages a diverse database of trivia knowledge spanning multiple categories and topics, allowing users to discover interesting and unexpected facts. While this endpoint delivers completely random trivia, the service also offers more targeted searches based on specific categories or topics when you need more focused information.

Retrieves a random biblical insight or truth from the extensive collection. This endpoint draws from the Uncovered Treasure API, which contains over 25,000 revealed truths meticulously documented by Phil Largent across a 25-year period, covering every Book and chapter of the Bible. The random selection feature provides users with spontaneous access to biblical wisdom and revelations without needing to specify particular passages or themes.

Retrieves the up-to-date results for a group within the Drillster platform. This endpoint accesses Drillster's cloud-based memorization system that helps users learn more efficiently in less time, allowing you to monitor group performance data. As part of Drillster's open API, this functionality enables integration with your own systems or custom memorization solutions, providing valuable learning analytics for teams or classes using the platform.

task_description: This task assists users in preparing for various academic and professional exams. It provides practice questions, answers, and definitions for technical terms across different fields.
